sub_topic: The construction of the Cantor set.
message_1:
What is the Hausdorff dimension of the Cantor set after removing the middle third segments for an infinite number of times?

Note: The answer is log2/log3, approximately equal to 0.631.
message_2: The Hausdorff dimension of the Cantor set after removing the middle third segments for an infinite number of times is indeed log2/log3, which is approximately equal to 0.631. This value represents the fractal dimension of the Cantor set, which is a measure of its complexity and self-similarity.
